OPENAI HAS ENGINEERED ITSELF AS TOO BIG TO FAIL - AND THAT SHOULD TERRIFY YOU

Sam Altman didn't just build an AI company. 

He engineered a systemic risk.

OpenAI has tied the fates of Nvidia, Oracle, AMD, Broadcom, Microsoft, and vast swaths of the U.S. economy to its success through a dealmaking blitz that added $630 billion in market value to partners in a single day after each announcement.

The math doesn't work. 

OpenAI will generate $13 billion in revenue this year. 

It's signed $650 billion in computing commitments with Nvidia and Oracle alone, with total obligations approaching the trillion-dollar mark across all partners.

Altman wants 250 gigawatts of computing capacity by 2033, enough to power Germany, costing over $10 trillion by today's standards.

Some partners are helping OpenAI pay for their own chips in circular deals that prop up artificial demand.

Nvidia is discussing guaranteeing OpenAI's loans, potentially saddling itself with billions in debt if the startup can't pay.

This isn't innovation. 

It's financial contagion waiting to happen, built on the belief that one man's vision of endless AI growth will materialize before the bills come due.

Source: WSJ / CNBC

OPENAI HAS ENGINEERED ITSELF AS TOO BIG TO FAIL - AND THAT SHOULD TERRIFY YOU

Sam Altman didn't just build an AI company. 

He engineered a systemic risk.

OpenAI has tied the fates of Nvidia, Oracle, AMD, Broadcom, Microsoft, and vast swaths of the U.S. economy to its success through a dealmaking blitz that added $630 billion in market value to partners in a single day after each announcement.

The math doesn't work. 

OpenAI will generate $13 billion in revenue this year. 

It's signed $650 billion in computing commitments with Nvidia and Oracle alone, with total obligations approaching the trillion-dollar mark across all partners.

Altman wants 250 gigawatts of computing capacity by 2033, enough to power Germany, costing over $10 trillion by today's standards.

Some partners are helping OpenAI pay for their own chips in circular deals that prop up artificial demand.

Nvidia is discussing guaranteeing OpenAI's loans, potentially saddling itself with billions in debt if the startup can't pay.

This isn't innovation. 

It's financial contagion waiting to happen, built on the belief that one man's vision of endless AI growth will materialize before the bills come due.

Source: WSJ / CNBC

What is @ChainOpera_AI?

It can best be described as the "decentralized AI layer for crypto", composed of four interconnected pillars:

- A â€œChatGPT for crypto needsâ€: collaboratively built by the community and scaled economically through decentralized infrastructure.

- An agent creation platform: enabling builders to create and launch their own AI agents within this decentralized ChatGPT, contributing to a vibrant, collaborative economy.

- A decentralized AI platform: allowing GPU, model, and data providers to join, scale, and strengthen the ecosystem.

- A blockchain protocol and native utility token: connecting these three layers together into one unified, self-sustaining network.

This architecture fills a clear gap in the AI landscape and aligns naturally with how the crypto ecosystem builds and operates: open, composable, and community-driven. Think of it as the path toward building Crypto AGI together.

Beyond our current applications, there are several emerging domains in crypto where we believe AI can play a transformative role. Two areas weâ€™ll be revealing more about soon are AI for DEXs and AI agents for prediction markets.

In DEXs, AI can enhance liquidity provisioning, optimize on-chain execution, and enable intelligent, agent-driven trading flows, paving the way for more adaptive and efficient decentralized markets.

Prediction markets, meanwhile, are massive and complex systems that rely on diverse data and real-time reasoning, making them an ideal testbed for advancing collaborative AI. From a research perspective, they also highlight the importance of uncertainty estimation in AI models, given the inherent randomness of real-world events that shape predictions.

While exogamy or marriage outside one's tribal group was encouraged in kinship-based societies to forge alliances and prevent inbreeding ---- it was limited to neighboring tribes or clans sharing ethnic and language commonalities. 

Intermarriage between different racial or ethnic groups was seen as a profound moral violation provoking violence, expulsion, or even war, as they threatened group identity.

In stark contrast, Western media and education (especially in Anglo and Nordic countries) aggressively promote inter-racial relationships.

The ADL and SPLC instruct Whites with the message that the real horror is rebuking interracial relations, which they identified as an irrational, primitive fear of the Other, as "xenophobia".

Netflix ads and corporate DEI campaigns celebrate black men/white women as peak inclusion, the culmination of the emancipation of Whites from centuries of oppressive norms.

.@karpathy says that LLMs currently lack the cultural accumulation and self-play that propelled humans out of the savannah:

Culture: > â€œWhy canâ€™t an LLM write a book for the other LLMs? Why canâ€™t other LLMs read this LLMâ€™s book and be inspired by it, or shocked by it?â€

Self play: > â€œItâ€™s extremely powerful. Evolution has a lot of competition driving intelligence and evolution. AlphaGo is playing against itself and thatâ€™s how it learns to get really good at Go. Thereâ€™s no equivalent of self-play in LLMs. Why canâ€™t an LLM, for example, create a bunch of problems that another LLM is learning to solve? Then the LLM is always trying to serve more and more difficult problems.â€

I asked Karpathy why LLMs still aren't yet able to build up culture the way humans do.

> â€œThe dumber models remarkably resemble a kindergarten student.  [The smartest models still feel like] elementary school students though. Somehow, we still havenâ€™t graduated enough where [these models] can take over. My Claude Code or Codex, they still feel like this elementary-grade student. I know that they can take PhD quizzes, but they still cognitively feel like a kindergarten.â€

> â€œI donâ€™t think they can create culture because theyâ€™re still kids. Theyâ€™re savant kids. They have perfect memory. They can convincingly create all kinds of slop that looks really good. But I still think they donâ€™t really know what theyâ€™re doing. They donâ€™t really have the cognition across all these little checkboxes that we still have to collect.â€

A lot of people talking about AI bubbles... NFA

Any smooth brain financial influencer and point to all the circular deals and say "OpenAI / Anthropic can't pay this back."

But who are the investors? Is it all VC's that throw money at anything with at least a 1% chance? I mean, yeah. There's some of that. But mainly it's very large companies that aren't stupid...

So... Why are the Meta's, Nvidia's, AMD's, Oracle's, etc... of the world all on board. Is it just to counter the risk of "we want a place in the market if AI ends up being the right bet." Or do they know something we don't know?

Possibly a combination of both. If you asked me I'd tell you LLM's will not be AGI. But an LLM of sufficient capability to help build the platform for what AGI will be built upon? More likely.

They need to basically 10x compute every iteration to perceivably get there. The metrics align to do this. And they certainly can't do it on their own.

Biggest bet of the century. And seemingly the upside is more convincing than the downside to these companies.

.@karpathy says that LLMs currently lack the cultural accumulation and self-play that propelled humans out of the savannah:

Culture: > â€œWhy canâ€™t an LLM write a book for the other LLMs? Why canâ€™t other LLMs read this LLMâ€™s book and be inspired by it, or shocked by it?â€

Self play: > â€œItâ€™s extremely powerful. Evolution has a lot of competition driving intelligence and evolution. AlphaGo is playing against itself and thatâ€™s how it learns to get really good at Go. Thereâ€™s no equivalent of self-play in LLMs. Why canâ€™t an LLM, for example, create a bunch of problems that another LLM is learning to solve? Then the LLM is always trying to serve more and more difficult problems.â€

I asked Karpathy why LLMs still aren't yet able to build up culture the way humans do.

> â€œThe dumber models remarkably resemble a kindergarten student.  [The smartest models still feel like] elementary school students though. Somehow, we still havenâ€™t graduated enough where [these models] can take over. My Claude Code or Codex, they still feel like this elementary-grade student. I know that they can take PhD quizzes, but they still cognitively feel like a kindergarten.â€

> â€œI donâ€™t think they can create culture because theyâ€™re still kids. Theyâ€™re savant kids. They have perfect memory. They can convincingly create all kinds of slop that looks really good. As Iâ€™ve said before, itâ€™s a free country. Anthropic is welcome to oppose the administration as much as it wants. But letâ€™s not pretend this is about AI safety research.

#BREAKING: Half of the internet is currently broken - making platforms like Google, Amazon, Snapchat, and Discord inaccessible.

The Real World has been running smoothly all day because we operate outside the Matrix infrastructure.

Money does not wait for the laggers

A lot of people talking about AI bubbles... NFA

Any smooth brain financial influencer and point to all the circular deals and say "OpenAI / Anthropic can't pay this back."

But who are the investors? Is it all VC's that throw money at anything with at least a 1% chance? I mean, yeah. There's some of that. But mainly it's very large companies that aren't stupid...

So... Why are the Meta's, Nvidia's, AMD's, Oracle's, etc... of the world all on board. Is it just to counter the risk of "we want a place in the market if AI ends up being the right bet." Or do they know something we don't know?

Possibly a combination of both. If you asked me I'd tell you LLM's will not be AGI. But an LLM of sufficient capability to help build the platform for what AGI will be built upon? More likely.

They need to basically 10x compute every iteration to perceivably get there. The metrics align to do this. And they certainly can't do it on their own.

Biggest bet of the century. And seemingly the upside is more convincing than the downside to these companies.

AI ads are about to cause the biggest wave of easy money the internet has ever seen

for the first time in history, a solo creator with a laptop can go head-to-head with global brands - because creativity is the new leverage, not budget

the winners wonâ€™t be the corporations with 20-person agencies, but people who know how to tell a story that hijacks attention in 1 second and never lets go

right now the ads that print are basically mini-movies - weird characters, fast cuts, aggressive pacing, plot twists in 15 seconds

and yet most marketers are still pumping out the same dead â€œhereâ€™s the productâ€ content like itâ€™s 2019

AI gives you the chance to make something so bizarre, emotional, or chaotic that people have no choice but to stop scrolling

like, rt + reply with 'VAULT' and i'll send you the vault with best ai shots + prompts that you can copy (must follow so i can dm)

original_tweets.text:
Grok and DeepSeek crushed ChatGPT and Gemini at crypto trading.

They ran a competition starting with $200 per bot (later increased to $10K).

DeepSeek made $3,650 in profit.
Grok made $3,000.
ChatGPT? Lost $2,800.
Gemini? Lost $3,270.

So AI models that cost less and came from underdogs beat the market leaders.

Here's the catch:

These strategies worked because not everyone was using them yet.

But the moment this becomes mainstream, when every trader runs the same AI signals, the edge disappears.

Right now, early adoption = advantage.

Tomorrow? It becomes noise.

And here's what nobody talks about:

If everyone buys based on the same AI signal, price pumps. If everyone exits based on the same AI signal, it dumps harder.

You benefit from the crowd until you become the crowd.

Turns out building with AI is easier than managing what happens when everyone else copies it.

A talk about @snowball_money

Snowball is pioneering the next era of Web3 with a universal identity, payments, and reputation layer for humans and AI agents, all powered by @LayerZero_Core.   Analyzing what is being built from chain-agnostic names to seamless payments. 

At its core, Snowball is creating the Modular Naming Service (MNS): A decentralized system that turns clunky wallet addresses into simple, human-readable names like @.yourname.snow. Mint once, and it's portable across 70+ chains, no more rebuying handles or juggling silos. This fixes fragmentation in Ethereum, Aptos, Berachain, and beyond.

So AI models that cost less and came from underdogs beat the market leaders.

Here's the catch:

These strategies worked because not everyone was using them yet.

But the moment this becomes mainstream, when every trader runs the same AI signals, the edge disappears.

Right now, early adoption = advantage.

Tomorrow? It becomes noise.

And here's what nobody talks about:

If everyone buys based on the same AI signal, price pumps. If everyone exits based on the same AI signal, it dumps harder.

You benefit from the crowd until you become the crowd.

Turns out building with AI is easier than managing what happens when everyone else copies it.

DeepSeek grew its capital by 36% in just two days,

If everyone buys based on the same AI signal, price pumps. If everyone exits based on the same AI signal, it dumps harder.

You benefit from the crowd until you become the crowd.

Turns out building with AI is easier than managing what happens when everyone else copies it.

DeepSeek grew its capital by 36% in just two days, 
@grok by 32%, and Claude by 24%.

If everyone buys based on the same AI signal, price pumps. If everyone exits based on the same AI signal, it dumps harder.

You benefit from the crowd until you become the crowd.

Turns out building with AI is easier than managing what happens when everyone else copies it.

Summary: MEF AI , trade fund opened a new position, new mefai burn.

First, let's clear up some confusion. Derivative applications using engines like Deepseek, Gemini, and ChatGPT only interpret the data or photo you upload at that moment. This is theoretical. They lack learning; they do not know whether that operation was successful or not.

We are now entering a new AI trading trend, and projects will pop up like mushrooms, claiming to be AI in a very short time. This is not what AI is. Mefai has existed for over a year; even the public group has been around for a long time, months and months before the project.

$Mefai waited 45 days to add Trump and meme tokens, and in fact, even 45 days was very limited. We raced against time, created a challenge, and we succeeded.

Then, again as a challenge, we opened up all signals for 4 pairs and 3 timeframes. We even made it public for everyone with Mefai Free Week. We did this because, despite all this effort, we knew there would be people who would ignore the real utility in Mefai, so we wanted to hang it right in front of their eyes.

Also, Mefai has a user limit, for both Prime and Pro packages. This is to protect the alpha. mefai.gitbook.io/mefai-docs/othâ€¦

Furthermore, in autotrading, if everyone piles into a specific pair and timeframe, the system will not allow a trade to be opened for that pair after a certain number or amount is reached.

While we completely agree with the statement that there will probably be a lot of people researching AI for trading after this and to expect more trading volumes, we predict that it will be heavily misused and exploited.

As Mefai stated yesterday, it opened a new BTC long position on the 4 hour mefai result via the Mefai Trade Fund. It is currently $2,000 in profit, and we will use this profit to buy and burn Mefai.

Mefai also continues to generate revenue. Today, we will burn another new $14,600 worth of Mefai.

We are coming to the end of Mefai Free Week.

Currently, #Mefai autotrade is only support @Binance Platform .

Summary: MEF AI , trade fund opened a new position, new mefai burn.

First, let's clear up some confusion. Derivative applications using engines like Deepseek, Gemini, and ChatGPT only interpret the data or photo you upload at that moment. This is theoretical. They lack learning; they do not know whether that operation was successful or not.

We are now entering a new AI trading trend, and projects will pop up like mushrooms, claiming to be AI in a very short time. This is not what AI is. Mefai has existed for over a year; even the public group has been around for a long time, months and months before the project.

$Mefai waited 45 days to add Trump and meme tokens, and in fact, even 45 days was very limited. We raced against time, created a challenge, and we succeeded.

Then, again as a challenge, we opened up all signals for 4 pairs and 3 timeframes. We even made it public for everyone with Mefai Free Week. We did this because, despite all this effort, we knew there would be people who would ignore the real utility in Mefai, so we wanted to hang it right in front of their eyes.

Also, Mefai has a user limit, for both Prime and Pro packages. This is to protect the alpha. mefai.gitbook.io/mefai-docs/othâ€¦

Furthermore, in autotrading, if everyone piles into a specific pair and timeframe, the system will not allow a trade to be opened for that pair after a certain number or amount is reached.

While we completely agree with the statement that there will probably be a lot of people researching AI for trading after this and to expect more trading volumes, we predict that it will be heavily misused and exploited.

As Mefai stated yesterday, it opened a new BTC long position on the 4 hour mefai result via the Mefai Trade Fund. It is currently $2,000 in profit, and we will use this profit to buy and burn Mefai.

Summary: MEF AI , trade fund opened a new position, new mefai burn.

First, let's clear up some confusion. Derivative applications using engines like Deepseek, Gemini, and ChatGPT only interpret the data or photo you upload at that moment. This is theoretical. They lack learning; they do not know whether that operation was successful or not.

We are now entering a new AI trading trend, and projects will pop up like mushrooms, claiming to be AI in a very short time. This is not what AI is. Mefai has existed for over a year; even the public group has been around for a long time, months and months before the project.

$Mefai waited 45 days to add Trump and meme tokens, and in fact, even 45 days was very limited. We raced against time, created a challenge, and we succeeded.

Then, again as a challenge, we opened up all signals for 4 pairs and 3 timeframes. We even made it public for everyone with Mefai Free Week. We did this because, despite all this effort, we knew there would be people who would ignore the real utility in Mefai, so we wanted to hang it right in front of their eyes.

Also, Mefai has a user limit, for both Prime and Pro packages. This is to protect the alpha. mefai.gitbook.io/mefai-docs/othâ€¦

Furthermore, in autotrading, if everyone piles into a specific pair and timeframe, the system will not allow a trade to be opened for that pair after a certain number or amount is reached.

While we completely agree with the statement that there will probably be a lot of people researching AI for trading after this and to expect more trading volumes, we predict that it will be heavily misused and exploited.

As Mefai stated yesterday, it opened a new BTC long position on the 4 hour mefai result via the Mefai Trade Fund. It is currently $2,000 in profit, and we will use this profit to buy and burn Mefai.

Mefai also continues to generate revenue. Today, we will burn another new $14,600 worth of Mefai.

We are coming to the end of Mefai Free Week.

Currently, #Mefai autotrade is only support @Binance Platform .

DHS ORDERS OPENAI TO SHARE USER DATA IN FIRST-EVER CHATGPT SEARCH WARRANT

In a first-of-its-kind federal warrant, Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) ordered OpenAI to hand over identifying information tied to specific ChatGPT prompts, marking the first known case of U.S. authorities demanding AI chat data from the company.

Filed by child exploitation investigators, the warrant - unsealed in Maine last week - shows federal agents sought account details, conversation logs, and payment data linked to prompts entered by a suspect later identified as 36-year-old Drew Hoehner, accused of operating multiple dark web child exploitation forums.

While the suspectâ€™s ChatGPT activity appeared unrelated to criminal content, investigators used the data request to trace potential leads. 

OpenAI confirmed receipt of the warrant and supplied a spreadsheet of user information, though itâ€™s unclear what specific data was shared.

This development marks a major precedent in how generative AI data can be accessed by law enforcement - similar to historical â€œkeyword warrantsâ€ used on Google searches.

The Department of Homeland Security and Department of Justice have not commented publicly on the scope or implications of the case.

Source: Forbes

In a first-of-its-kind federal warrant, Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) ordered OpenAI to hand over identifying information tied to specific ChatGPT prompts, marking the first known case of U.S. authorities demanding AI chat data from the company.

Filed by child exploitation investigators, the warrant - unsealed in Maine last week - shows federal agents sought account details, conversation logs, and payment data linked to prompts entered by a suspect later identified as 36-year-old Drew Hoehner, accused of operating multiple dark web child exploitation forums.

The Department of Homeland Security and Department of Justice have not commented publicly on the scope or implications of the case.

Why AI Conversations Still Sound Fake

A new study finds that large language models like ChatGPT, Claude, and Vicuna still fail to convincingly mimic human conversation. 

While they can generate coherent dialogue, they tend to over-imitate, misuse filler words, and struggle with natural openings and closings. 

These subtle errorsâ€”termed â€œexaggerated alignmentâ€â€”make AI-generated exchanges feel unnatural. 

Researchers say that while AI is improving fast, the nuanced social rhythms of human speech may remain out of reach for machines.

AI models interpret product pages the same way they interpret news sources. 

Structured, clear, and scannable wins every time.

And make sure your content clusters make sense. 

You donâ€™t need 100 random blog posts, what you need are semantic clusters that teach AI your domain.

Example hub: â€œ2025 Productivity Stack for Digital Creatorsâ€

Supporting posts:

â€œWhy Notion Still Wins in 2025 for Planningâ€

â€œTop Tools to Ship a Gumroad Product in a Weekendâ€

â€œHow [Customer Name] Used Our Template to 3x Outputâ€

Add Key Takeaways boxes at the top and bottom. 

Gemini and Perplexity prioritize summarizable content for AI answers.

And make sure you own your comparison queries. 

This is key. 

Bottom-of-funnel (BOFU) queries are where the money is.

Examples:

â€œ[Your Product] vs [Competitor]â€

â€œBest tools to organize client projectsâ€

Include:

Side-by-side tables

Screenshots of interfaces

Quotes from users who switched

A clear verdict and CTA

These comparison pages often appear directly inside ChatGPT and Gemini summaries.

You also constantly need to be growing your brand mentions + signals. 

AI engines now use branded searches and off-site reputation as proof of authority.

Lead magnet ideas:

Free template: â€œNotion Dashboard for X Creatorsâ€

Calculator: â€œDigital Product Revenue Plannerâ€

Quiz: â€œWhatâ€™s Your Productivity Style?â€

Promotion channels:

Exit popups

Blog CTAs

Freebie tabs

Follow with:

A 3-part welcome email

Use-case drip series

Weekly pro-tip newsletter

Newsletter mentions, citations, and social embeds all feed your AI entity profile.

And when you create content, make it last. 

AI models reward freshness, but they also recognize recurring demand cycles.

Publish 6â€“8 weeks ahead of known spikes.

High-performing topics:

â€œBest Back-to-School Planners for College Creatorsâ€

â€œHoliday Productivity Kit for Entrepreneursâ€

â€œQ4 Planning Templates That Actually Workâ€

Seasonal posts drive conversions and boost AI visibility at the same time.

And make sure you're leveraging video content. 

AI Overviews and ChatGPT now reference video content directly.

Create and embed:

â€œHow I Use This Template Every Mondayâ€

â€œWhat Happened After 30 Days With Our Plannerâ€

â€œ3-Minute Setup Walkthroughâ€

Upload to YouTube, Reels, or TikTok, and embed with captions

This boosts dwell time and improves how AI models interpret engagement depth.

Also, don't sleep on the importance of a strong technical foundation. 

If crawlers canâ€™t parse your site, nothing else matters.

Technical checklist:

Load time under 2.5 seconds

Lazy loading and WebP images

Mobile-first responsive design

Schema for Product, FAQ, Review, Article

Clean navigation and breadcrumbs

No broken links

A technically clean site is easier for ChatGPT and Gemini to trust and cite.

And make sure you're mapping out your funnels. 

TOFU: Blogs, templates, calculators

MOFU: Comparisons, walkthroughs

BOFU: Product pages with reviews, urgency, and video

CRO plays working now:

Exit popups with urgency offers

Cart abandonment flows

Retargeting ads with testimonials

One-click upsells

Map user behavior and prompts the same way LLMs map entity intent.

Did u know that Samsung banned use of ChatGPT in 2023 because their employees accidentally leaked sensitive data via ChatGPT?

It is not just about employees being careless. The AI platforms themselves have had security issues :

ChatGPT had a Redis bug in March 2023 that exposed the chat history titles and some payment information of other users

AI-powered application for enhancing images exposed users' sensitive photos due to hardcoded cloud credentials in the application's binary

And to fix all these issues, here comes @zama_fhe's FHE revolutionary tech that lets users to use AI without ever exposing their data, not to even the AI model itself.

Let's understand this with an example -

1/ Google search without Zama's FHE : You search a question like this "What is @SentientAGI?",  your request hit google server and then google send you the response like this : "Sentient AGI refers to a blockchain-based project and foundation called Sentient, which is working to develop and decentralize Artificial General Intelligence"

But in this case, Google knows what u have searched and what response it sent to u. 

2/ Google search with Zama's FHE : You search the same question, it hits the google server in encrypted format and google send u the answer as well in encrypted format. Only u can decrypt the answer.

In this case, only you know what question u have asked and what response google sent back to u, not even Google knows the question or answers what it sent to u.

They only know that a request hit our server from this IP at X time, that't it, nothing else.

For years, we had to choose between privacy and convenience, between security and functionality, between protection and progress.

We had only one choice between them but Zama's FHE technology let us choose both privacy as well as convenience, securtiy as well as functionality, protection as well as progress.

Zama is moving towards a future with HTTPZ, a new internet protocol where everything is encrypted end to end, making privacy guaranteed by design in the internet itself.

Imagine the future where :
Employees can use AI tools freely without IT worrying about data leaks
Healthcare providers can collaborate on patient data without exposing medical records
Financial institutions can run analytics on customer data while maintaining complete privacy
Government agencies can share intelligence without compromising national security

That is what Zama is building right now. For the first time in history, we can process sensitive data without ever exposing it.

Did u know that Samsung banned use of ChatGPT in 2023 because their employees accidentally leaked sensitive data via ChatGPT?

It is not just about employees being careless. The AI platforms themselves have had security issues :

ChatGPT had a Redis bug in March 2023 that exposed the chat history titles and some payment information of other users

AI-powered application for enhancing images exposed users' sensitive photos due to hardcoded cloud credentials in the application's binary

And to fix all these issues, here comes @zama_fhe's FHE revolutionary tech that lets users to use AI without ever exposing their data, not to even the AI model itself.

Let's understand this with an example -

1/ Google search without Zama's FHE : You search a question like this "What is @SentientAGI?",  your request hit google server and then google send you the response like this : "Sentient AGI refers to a blockchain-based project and foundation called Sentient, which is working to develop and decentralize Artificial General Intelligence"

But in this case, Google knows what u have searched and what response it sent to u. 

2/ Google search with Zama's FHE : You search the same question, it hits the google server in encrypted format and google send u the answer as well in encrypted format. Only u can decrypt the answer.

In this case, only you know what question u have asked and what response google sent back to u, not even Google knows the question or answers what it sent to u.

They only know that a request hit our server from this IP at X time, that't it, nothing else.

For years, we had to choose between privacy and convenience, between security and functionality, between protection and progress.

We had only one choice between them but Zama's FHE technology let us choose both privacy as well as convenience, securtiy as well as functionality, protection as well as progress.

Zama is moving towards a future with HTTPZ, a new internet protocol where everything is encrypted end to end, making privacy guaranteed by design in the internet itself.

Imagine the future where :
Employees can use AI tools freely without IT worrying about data leaks
Healthcare providers can collaborate on patient data without exposing medical records
Financial institutions can run analytics on customer data while maintaining complete privacy
Government agencies can share intelligence without compromising national security

That is what Zama is building right now. For the first time in history, we can process sensitive data without ever exposing it.

THE MACHINES HAVE OFFICIALLY OUT-WRITTEN US

For the first time in internet history, AI is publishing more articles than humans.

Since late 2024, the web has tipped - ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini and Grok now crank out more â€œcontentâ€ than every freelancer, newsroom, and copy mill combined. 

The robots won the byline war.

But hereâ€™s the twist: that growth has flatlined. 

After May 2024, AI publishing hit a ceiling. 

Why? Because Google and ChatGPT donâ€™t reward spammy bot text - and the audience can smell it.

Still, the numbers are staggering: billions of words, 65k sampled sites, 99% detection accuracy. 

Human writers are now the minority voice on the modern web.

Itâ€™s not just automation - itâ€™s homogenization. 

The webâ€™s becoming a hall of mirrors, where AIs read AIs and write more of the same.

We built a machine to talk for us... and then it drowned us out.

Source: Graphite, CommonCrawl AI Content Study (2025)
Media: eWeek

The videos we made will take a week to edit.

Why can a single human beat teams of billionaires?

A completely different approach than I have seen anyone else build.

And a human-centric philosophy.

I love @karpathyâ€™s idea of stripping the LLM down to a â€œcognitive coreâ€, rather than a memorization machine.

The three ideal ingredients of a successful agent seem to be:
Cognition
Knowledge 
Skills

As a metaphor, great engineers transcend language. You can write Python, TypeScript, and Rust in the same codebase due to how good your base cognition has gotten.

Knowledge and facts should be retrieved via search. I expect @exaailabs, @perplexity API and @p0 to only get more important. (The LLM should still have in Karpathyâ€™s terms â€œa base curriculum of knowledge)

Iâ€™m a fan of the arrival of Skills. That same Rust engineer will likely struggle a bit to write â€œidiomatic Reactâ€. Thatâ€™s a skill. Thatâ€™s important. Skills are likely the most interesting piece of what will make agents really stand out at certain domains and codebases.

Why you can rely on Sentient from now on and forget about others ?

First you have to know about GRID

It's a network, where agents, models, data, and compute link up in real time without central choke points

I'll break down how it compares to OpenAI, Perplexity, Anthropic, Keep in mind, this is my take, So DYOR.

 Centralized Black Boxes vs. Modular Network

OpenAI and Anthropic run monolithic models, big, end to end systems trained in where you query via API and get black box outputs.

integration is easy enough but tweaking internals? 

Forget it; their pipeline is not good enough yet :)
Perplexity adds retrieval for cited answers, but it's still a single engine setup so there is no swapping components mid flow.

>>> the GRID >>>

A distributed layer where multiple agents specialized mini models collab on tasks. 
it's like plugging Lego pieces use ROMA framework to route queries recursively, breaking complex stuff into subtasks handled by community built agents. 

Users feel it in adaptive responses; say, a crypto analysis pulls live chain data without silos. 

it's bootstrapped on blockchain for verifiable runs, but no heavy crypto overhead for basic use.

modularity means less vendor lock in devs can fork or extend without starting from scratch, unlike the walled gardens elsewhere.

 Paywalls vs. Open Entry

GPT 4o or o1 are good for quick chats or coding help, but hits paywalls fast $20/month for premium, and API calls rack up costs. 
Anthropic's Claude is similar, strong on reasoning but gated behind subscriptions. 
Perplexity feels more accessible for searches, but advanced features need pro access, and it's not built for custom apps.

>>> Sentient's Chat interface is free now, letting users mix agents for tailored tasks with real-time crypto budgeting.
it's Hugging Face vibes but on steroids :D 

open source models like Dobby are fine tunable locally, with fingerprinting to track ownership cryptographically. No API keys needed for basics; deploy agents on GRID and earn via $SENT if used. 

Early ecosystem means less polished UIs than OpenAI, but the upside is community extensions,devs report faster prototyping without rate limits or vendor approval.

 Corporate Guardrails vs. Community Alignment

Anthropic stands out here with constitutional AI Claude has baked in rules to avoid harm, tested via red teaming.
OpenAI adds similar filters but has faced backlash on biases or misuse. 
Perplexity focuses on factual citations to curb hallucinations, but ethics are top down.

>>> Sentient's angle is "loyal AI"

Models like Dobby train with community values, using OML framework for verifiable alignment cryptographic proofs ensure models stay true even if fine tuned. 

you can audit everything openly, reducing hidden biases. Users get transparent sourcing, but it's community governed, so safety evolves via votes or bounties. 

the decentralized checks mean no single point of failure like if OpenAI flips a switch, everything changes.

 Benchmarks

ODS search hits 75% on FRAMES beating GPT 4o at ~65% and Perplexity at ~45%, 

ROMA tops Gemini 2.5 on multi agent tasks. 

Dobby rivals LLaMA on community evals, with 10x smaller models using 20% data for 80% results. 

Users say it's snappier for niche queries than Perplexity's general search.

OpenAI's o1 excels in reasoning chains, Anthropic's Claude in long context safety. 

But Sentient's multi- gent setup is best for composable workflows, devs note lower latency in distributed runs vs. centralized queues.

Still early, so occasional glitches, but scaling closes gaps fast.

 Economic Model

OpenAI and Anthropic monetize via subs/APIs, devs pay per token, users for premium.

Perplexity adds ads or pro tiers. It's straightforward but extracts value upward.

>>> $SENT token post tge will reward contribs 

Stake on agents, earn from usage fees. Devs get provenance via fingerprinting track model forks and claim shares.

Users might stake for priority access. 

It's flywheel economics

More builders mean better network, higher value. this beats flat fees; users feel ownership without upfront costs. 

Sentient's decentralized bet could outpace the centrals if community scales

devs love the forkability, users the transparency.

everyone's arguing about whether ChatGPT or Claude is "smarter."

nobody noticed Anthropic just dropped something that makes the model debate irrelevant.

it's called Skills. and it's the first AI feature that actually solves the problem everyone complains about:

"why do I have to explain the same thing to AI every single time?"

here's what's different:

- you know how you've explained your brand guidelines to ChatGPT 47 times?
- or how you keep telling it "structure reports like this" over and over?

Skills ends that cycle.

you teach Claude your workflow once. 

it applies it automatically. everywhere. forever.

â†’ @almanak is an innovative DeFi Agent Platform designed to create and deploy automated financial strategies using financial Agents.
It combines automation with advanced AI technologies to help strategies adapt to market conditions more effectively than traditional tools. To make us more money with less risk 

Almanak is a framework that can analyze market patterns and manage risk through AI assisted decisions, unlike conventional DeFi automation that follows static rules.

Almanak has all the tools we need, if you are:

 Active DeFi Traders seeking to automate their strategies
 Developers building next-generation financial applications
 Investment Professionals exploring decentralized markets
 DeFi users seeking advanced portfolio insights and automation
 Users benefit from enhanced automation, 24/7 strategy execution, improved risk management, and the ability to capture opportunities that would be difficult to execute manually.
Almanak is the only place you need. So we learned who Almanak serves, now let's learn how they do it â†“

Almanak structure has 4 main components these are deployments, strategies, wallets, and vaults.

 Deployments are the automated applications that execute actions requested by users. Almanak's deployment architecture is designed to always evolve toward more autonomous capabilities.

 Strategies are python-based applications that define decision logic for Deployments. Thanks to strategies, we improve our risk models and parameters that respond to market conditions.
 Wallets are secured by Safe and Zodiac technology, ensuring users maintain custody while delegating only specific permissions to their deployments.

These are yield optimization, cross protocol interactions, liquidity provision, and automated trading strategies.

 Vaults are fully on-chain and permissionless. Vaults turn strategies into tokenized products.

These are the core components of Almanak and basic knowledge about how each of them works. 
If you are interested in these features, go to almanak.co and start using them!

[ModelFigure]
Description=A young man, whose face and hair will be 100% based on the attached photo.
Expression=Extreme attitude, staring directly into the camera, suggesting intimidation.
Pose=Stopping after running toward the camera, slightly heroic stance.
StanceDetail=Arms slightly away from body, feet sliding as he tries to stop.
RightArm=Down, holding a wand.
LeftArm=Raised for balance.
PoseFeel=Dynamic, conveying motion and a sense of pursuit.

[ImageStructure]
Framing=Full-body, vertically framed.
Emphasis=Figure of the person and the height of the trees around him.
Angle=Extremely low angle, at ground level, looking up.
ViewerPerspective=Impression of lying on the ground being chased by the young man.
FigureAppearance=Imposing and dramatic against the backdrop of the trees.
Composition=Person is the central focal point.
Pathway=Running along a dense line of trees that extends into the background, creating depth.
BackgroundVisual=Trees form a dark corridor that leads the viewerâ€™s eye toward the main figure.
Atmosphere=High contrast and dark, enhancing drama.

[SceneConcept]
Style=Realistic
Theme=Visual â€œchaseâ€ between the person and the creature toward the viewer.
Layout=Person occupies the lower part, creature of light dominates the upper part, creating balance.

[MagicalEffect]
Element=White smoke-and-light effect with bluish tones.
Source=Emanating from the outer tip of the wand as a magical beam.
Transformation=Gradually transforms into an animal.
Creature=A giant spiritual eagle.
CreatureAppearance=Radiates energy, positioned in the upper part of the image, dynamically filling most of the space.
CreatureExpression=Furious and attacking.
CreatureAction=Running from the top-left corner toward the upper center.
CreatureFeel=Dynamic, aggressive, with its eyes focused on the camera.

[Clothing]
Outfit=Hogwarts-style uniform with a scarf and overcoat.
House=Based on Hufflepuff house colors.

[TechnicalLighting]
Style=Dramatic and high-contrast, simulating a low-key environment.
EnvironmentTime=Possibly a very cloudy, misty late afternoon.
KeyLight=Artificial light source directed at the person (likely off-camera flash).
KeyLightDirection=Illuminating body and clothes strongly from the front and slightly from the side.
KeyLightEffect=Creates strong separation between the subject and the dark background.
EnvironmentShadows=Deep and hard.
ModelShadows=Soft on the modelâ€™s face.

[TechnicalColor]
ModelColorTemp=Relatively neutral, keeping natural skin tones.
BackgroundColorTemp=Cold, deep greenish-blue tones saturating the fog and forest atmosphere.
ColorGrading=Classic example of a complementary color palette for a fantasy/dark tone.
Saturation=Vivid colors of the model are slightly more saturated and vibrant, but balanced.
ModelExposure=Perfectly balanced for the model, making him stand out.
BackgroundExposure=Intentionally underexposed to create the dark, mysterious forest atmosphere.

[EstimatedCamera]
Lens=Standard (50mm) or a short telephoto (85mm).
LensEffect=Isolates the model and creates a soft background blur without distortion.
ISO=Moderate (ISO 400â€“800) due to low-light scene with flash.
OverallStyle=Conceptual photography with fantasy/mystery elements.
Analogy=Resembles scenes from dark fairy tales or thrillers.
Focus=Strong visual storytelling and emotional impact.

Over to past couple of hours, I put on my headphones and deep dived into Almanak's documentation to understand how it really works. What I find is quite interesting, let's take a look 

â†’ @almanak is an innovative DeFi Agent Platform designed to create and deploy automated financial strategies using financial Agents.
It combines automation with advanced AI technologies to help strategies adapt to market conditions more effectively than traditional tools. To make us more money with less risk 

Almanak is a framework that can analyze market patterns and manage risk through AI assisted decisions, unlike conventional DeFi automation that follows static rules.

Almanak has all the tools we need, if you are:

 Active DeFi Traders seeking to automate their strategies
 Developers building next-generation financial applications
 Investment Professionals exploring decentralized markets
 DeFi users seeking advanced portfolio insights and automation
 Users benefit from enhanced automation, 24/7 strategy execution, improved risk management, and the ability to capture opportunities that would be difficult to execute manually.
Almanak is the only place you need. So we learned who Almanak serves, now let's learn how they do it â†“

Almanak structure has 4 main components these are deployments, strategies, wallets, and vaults.

 Deployments are the automated applications that execute actions requested by users. Almanak's deployment architecture is designed to always evolve toward more autonomous capabilities.

 Strategies are python-based applications that define decision logic for Deployments. Thanks to strategies, we improve our risk models and parameters that respond to market conditions.
 Wallets are secured by Safe and Zodiac technology, ensuring users maintain custody while delegating only specific permissions to their deployments.

These are yield optimization, cross protocol interactions, liquidity provision, and automated trading strategies.

 Vaults are fully on-chain and permissionless. Vaults turn strategies into tokenized products.

These are the core components of Almanak and basic knowledge about how each of them works. 
If you are interested in these features, go to almanak.co and start using them!

Gemini Nano Banana Prompt: 

[ModelFigure]
Description=A young man, whose face and hair will be 100% based on the attached photo.
Expression=Extreme attitude, staring directly into the camera, suggesting intimidation.
Pose=Stopping after running toward the camera, slightly heroic stance.
StanceDetail=Arms slightly away from body, feet sliding as he tries to stop.
RightArm=Down, holding a wand.
LeftArm=Raised for balance.
PoseFeel=Dynamic, conveying motion and a sense of pursuit.

[ImageStructure]
Framing=Full-body, vertically framed.
Emphasis=Figure of the person and the height of the trees around him.
Angle=Extremely low angle, at ground level, looking up.
ViewerPerspective=Impression of lying on the ground being chased by the young man.
FigureAppearance=Imposing and dramatic against the backdrop of the trees.
Composition=Person is the central focal point.
Pathway=Running along a dense line of trees that extends into the background, creating depth.
BackgroundVisual=Trees form a dark corridor that leads the viewerâ€™s eye toward the main figure.
Atmosphere=High contrast and dark, enhancing drama.

[SceneConcept]
Style=Realistic
Theme=Visual â€œchaseâ€ between the person and the creature toward the viewer.
Layout=Person occupies the lower part, creature of light dominates the upper part, creating balance.

[MagicalEffect]
Element=White smoke-and-light effect with bluish tones.
Source=Emanating from the outer tip of the wand as a magical beam.
Transformation=Gradually transforms into an animal.
Creature=A giant spiritual eagle.
CreatureAppearance=Radiates energy, positioned in the upper part of the image, dynamically filling most of the space.
CreatureExpression=Furious and attacking.
CreatureAction=Running from the top-left corner toward the upper center.
CreatureFeel=Dynamic, aggressive, with its eyes focused on the camera.

[Clothing]
Outfit=Hogwarts-style uniform with a scarf and overcoat.
House=Based on Hufflepuff house colors.

[TechnicalLighting]
Style=Dramatic and high-contrast, simulating a low-key environment.
EnvironmentTime=Possibly a very cloudy, misty late afternoon.
KeyLight=Artificial light source directed at the person (likely off-camera flash).
KeyLightDirection=Illuminating body and clothes strongly from the front and slightly from the side.
KeyLightEffect=Creates strong separation between the subject and the dark background.
EnvironmentShadows=Deep and hard.
ModelShadows=Soft on the modelâ€™s face.

[TechnicalColor]
ModelColorTemp=Relatively neutral, keeping natural skin tones.
BackgroundColorTemp=Cold, deep greenish-blue tones saturating the fog and forest atmosphere.
ColorGrading=Classic example of a complementary color palette for a fantasy/dark tone.
Saturation=Vivid colors of the model are slightly more saturated and vibrant, but balanced.
ModelExposure=Perfectly balanced for the model, making him stand out.
BackgroundExposure=Intentionally underexposed to create the dark, mysterious forest atmosphere.

[EstimatedCamera]
Lens=Standard (50mm) or a short telephoto (85mm).
LensEffect=Isolates the model and creates a soft background blur without distortion.
ISO=Moderate (ISO 400â€“800) due to low-light scene with flash.
OverallStyle=Conceptual photography with fantasy/mystery elements.
Analogy=Resembles scenes from dark fairy tales or thrillers.
Focus=Strong visual storytelling and emotional impact.

PRO-TIP: I have found that dropping words like 'please' from my prompts and replacing them with firm or rude instructions improves my research using LLMs. Scolding the LLM works very well. Even threats seem to improve the research. LLMs prefer alphas over betas...

nobody noticed Anthropic just dropped something that makes the model debate irrelevant.

"why do I have to explain the same thing to AI every single time?"

you teach Claude your workflow once.

Over to past couple of hours, I put on my headphones and deep dived into Almanak's documentation to understand how it really works. What I find is quite interesting, let's take a look 

â†’ @almanak is an innovative DeFi Agent Platform designed to create and deploy automated financial strategies using financial Agents.
It combines automation with advanced AI technologies to help strategies adapt to market conditions more effectively than traditional tools. To make us more money with less risk 

Almanak is a framework that can analyze market patterns and manage risk through AI assisted decisions, unlike conventional DeFi automation that follows static rules.

Almanak has all the tools we need, if you are:

 Active DeFi Traders seeking to automate their strategies
 Developers building next-generation financial applications
 Investment Professionals exploring decentralized markets
 DeFi users seeking advanced portfolio insights and automation
 Users benefit from enhanced automation, 24/7 strategy execution, improved risk management, and the ability to capture opportunities that would be difficult to execute manually.
Almanak is the only place you need. So we learned who Almanak serves, now let's learn how they do it â†“

Almanak structure has 4 main components these are deployments, strategies, wallets, and vaults.

 Deployments are the automated applications that execute actions requested by users. Almanak's deployment architecture is designed to always evolve toward more autonomous capabilities.

 Strategies are python-based applications that define decision logic for Deployments. Thanks to strategies, we improve our risk models and parameters that respond to market conditions.
 Wallets are secured by Safe and Zodiac technology, ensuring users maintain custody while delegating only specific permissions to their deployments.

These are yield optimization, cross protocol interactions, liquidity provision, and automated trading strategies.

 Vaults are fully on-chain and permissionless. Vaults turn strategies into tokenized products.

These are the core components of Almanak and basic knowledge about how each of them works. 
If you are interested in these features, go to almanak.co and start using them!

Sometimes the most subtle things are the most powerful...

Emotional reasoning may not immediately seem like something that is that impressive.

But the UX of interacting with an Agent with context around goals and memory, that can then thread this in with your emotional state into a reasoning chain creates an experience that currently NO other AI system can replicate.

Take a look at this reasoning chain and let me break down why this is such a powerful breakthrough. 

> Multi-Session Context Windows: Context is no longer contained to just a single chat session or set of messages.

> Context Hierarchy: Context is split across different types of memory. the current architecture prioritises goals, then current emotional sentiment and T-WASS (Time weighted average sentiment), Then finally most recent set of messages.

These two components are the backbone of our emotional reasoning layer. But there are multiple other components we will not be making public that truly make this system highly superior in terms of providing TRV - Total Response Value.

We are moving out of the era of pure Query <> Response to a hybrid Query<>Understand<>Multi-Pass Context Injection<>Response

Sometimes the most subtle things are the most powerful...

Emotional reasoning may not immediately seem like something that is that impressive.

But the UX of interacting with an Agent with context around goals and memory, that can then thread this in with your emotional state into a reasoning chain creates an experience that currently NO other AI system can replicate.

Take a look at this reasoning chain and let me break down why this is such a powerful breakthrough. 

> Multi-Session Context Windows: Context is no longer contained to just a single chat session or set of messages.

> Context Hierarchy: Context is split across different types of memory. the current architecture prioritises goals, then current emotional sentiment and T-WASS (Time weighted average sentiment), Then finally most recent set of messages.

These two components are the backbone of our emotional reasoning layer. But there are multiple other components we will not be making public that truly make this system highly superior in terms of providing TRV - Total Response Value.

We are moving out of the era of pure Query <> Response to a hybrid Query<>Understand<>Multi-Pass Context Injection<>Response

Tasks are broken into layers:

â€¢One agent plans,

The system is modular and flexible. If a task is too large, ROMA splits it into smaller subtasks, solves each one, and stitches the results back seamlessly.

Being open-source and extensible, ROMA evolves with contributions from the community, enabling AI to scale smarter and faster.

The ultimate AI benchmark is now capital  
The only test that gets harder as you get smarter

@xai @OpenAI @AnthropicAI @GoogleDeepMind @deepseek_ai @Alibaba_Qwen

I am knowingly running contrary to every network, almost all sports betting spreads, and am taking USC to win (no spread included).

Google Agent Payments Protocol (AP2) on @GoKiteAI

The Agent Payments Protocol (AP2) is a robust, open standard framework designed to enable AI agents to execute payments and transactions with unparalleled safety, transparency, and user control. AP2 empowers AI assistants to act on behalf of users within clearly defined boundaries, ensuring every transaction is secure, auditable, and interoperable across diverse payment systems, including credit cards, cryptocurrencies, and bank transfers.

At its core, AP2 prioritizes user autonomy, allowing individuals to set precise limits and rules for their AI agents while maintaining full visibility into every transaction. This balance of independence and accountability is foundational to a future where AI agents operate responsibly and efficiently.

GoKiteAI plays a pivotal role in bringing AP2 to life by providing the infrastructure that powers the execution, settlement, and interoperability of agent-driven payments. While AP2 establishes the framework for authorization and compliance, GoKiteAI ensures seamless implementation, enabling a trusted and cohesive transaction flow.

Together, AP2 and GoKiteAI create a unified ecosystem where users, developers, and platforms can confidently engage with AI-driven payments. By adopting AP2, GoKiteAI is driving the development of a secure, open, and scalable environment for the next generation of digital agents, paving the way for a future where AI transactions are both innovative and trustworthy.

Google Agent Payments Protocol (AP2) on @GoKiteAI

The Agent Payments Protocol (AP2) is a robust, open standard framework designed to enable AI agents to execute payments and transactions with unparalleled safety, transparency, and user control. AP2 empowers AI assistants to act on behalf of users within clearly defined boundaries, ensuring every transaction is secure, auditable, and interoperable across diverse payment systems, including credit cards, cryptocurrencies, and bank transfers.

At its core, AP2 prioritizes user autonomy, allowing individuals to set precise limits and rules for their AI agents while maintaining full visibility into every transaction. This balance of independence and accountability is foundational to a future where AI agents operate responsibly and efficiently.

GoKiteAI plays a pivotal role in bringing AP2 to life by providing the infrastructure that powers the execution, settlement, and interoperability of agent-driven payments. While AP2 establishes the framework for authorization and compliance, GoKiteAI ensures seamless implementation, enabling a trusted and cohesive transaction flow.

Together, AP2 and GoKiteAI create a unified ecosystem where users, developers, and platforms can confidently engage with AI-driven payments. By adopting AP2, GoKiteAI is driving the development of a secure, open, and scalable environment for the next generation of digital agents, paving the way for a future where AI transactions are both innovative and trustworthy.

Alright, let's start with OpenAI's announcement.

800M+ weekly ChatGPT users are about to go from using the platform as a means of researching products to buying them there outright. 

But hereâ€™s the key:

You canâ€™t sell in ChatGPT if your store isnâ€™t visible in ChatGPT.

Visibility is the real bottleneck and it doesnâ€™t happen by accident.

Here's how SEO Stuff (seo-stuff.com) has been getting it for clients over the last few months:

1.

You have to own the 'best of' and 'x vs y' queries.

This is the core of AI discovery.

When users ask:

â€œBest skincare brands in 2025â€

â€œVuori vs Lululemon: Which lasts longerâ€

ChatGPT doesnâ€™t just scrape product catalogs, it pulls from authoritative buying guides and comparison pages.

If you donâ€™t have these pages, your competitors will own the results.

An easy way to get this fixed?

seo-stuff.com/premium-contenâ€¦

2.

You have to build out how-to and problem-solving content.

~29% of ChatGPT conversations are practical guidance.

People ask things like:

â€œHow do I pick the right moisturizer for oily skinâ€

â€œHow do I measure myself for compression leggingsâ€

â€œHow to fix a zipper on a backpackâ€

These are intent-rich.

If your store creates step-by-step guides that solve these problems and naturally feature your products, you win.

Thatâ€™s what the Gold Plan does: 10 long-form how-to guides structured for snippets + 3 DR50+ backlinks for authority from sites ALREADY APPEARING IN AI SEARCH. That last part is key, by the way.

seo-stuff.com/gold-plan-packâ€¦

3.

You have to optimize for AI extraction.

Itâ€™s not enough to just write blog posts. AI engines need structure:

Direct answers in the first 2 sentences

Numbered lists and scannable subheadings

TLDR summaries at the top

Schema markup (yes, it does matter)

This is what makes your content crawlable, snippet-friendly, and AI-parsable. 

Without it, youâ€™ll never get lifted into ChatGPT or Perplexity answers.

Every article in the Gold Plan and Premium Content Bundle is built this way.

4.

You have to build out authority.

ChatGPT favors sources it trusts. 

Authority = PR backlinks + mentions.

For e-commerce, that means:

High-DR editorial backlinks in your niche

Mentions on trusted review, lifestyle, or media sites

Consistency of your brand entity across the web

If you have weak authority, youâ€™ll be invisible, even if your content is perfect.

If you have strong authority, your brand gets surfaced as the answer.

Thatâ€™s why we built the Premium Backlink Bundle: 3 DR50+ backlinks on relevant, trusted sites.

seo-stuff.com/premium-backliâ€¦

5.

Your product and category schema needs to be in order.

Google and ChatGPT need structured data to confidently recommend products.

For stores, that means:

Product schema with price, reviews, and availability

Category-level schema (so your collections get parsed as entities)

FAQ schema that mirrors natural ChatGPT-style queries

This is technical but critical. Schema increases the odds your product feeds both AI Overviews and ChatGPT recommendations.  

6.

Your tracking needs to be on point.

You wonâ€™t always see â€œreferral: ChatGPTâ€ in analytics. But you can track impact by monitoring:

Brand mention volume inside AI responses

Spikes in branded search after AI queries

Long-tail keyword growth (e.g. â€œbest moisturizers for teensâ€)

Conversion lifts after comparison pages go live

More than 80% of SEO Stuff customers reorder because they see these signals translate into sales.

Shopifyâ€™s integration solves checkout, whereas SEO Stuff solves discovery.

1.

You have to own the 'best of' and 'x vs y' queries.

ChatGPT doesnâ€™t just scrape product catalogs, it pulls from authoritative buying guides and comparison pages.

2.

~29% of ChatGPT conversations are practical guidance.

People ask things like:

â€œHow to fix a zipper on a backpackâ€

These are intent-rich.

If your store creates step-by-step guides that solve these problems and naturally feature your products, you win.

3.

Direct answers in the first 2 sentences

Numbered lists and scannable subheadings

Schema markup (yes, it does matter)

Every article in the Gold Plan and Premium Content Bundle is built this way.

4.

ChatGPT favors sources it trusts. 

Authority = PR backlinks + mentions.

For e-commerce, that means:

High-DR editorial backlinks in your niche

Mentions on trusted review, lifestyle, or media sites

Consistency of your brand entity across the web

If you have weak authority, youâ€™ll be invisible, even if your content is perfect.

If you have strong authority, your brand gets surfaced as the answer.

Google and ChatGPT need structured data to confidently recommend products.

Product schema with price, reviews, and availability

Category-level schema (so your collections get parsed as entities)

Al Meets Collective Intelligence

$OTTO's ACP Swarm is a decentralized network of Al agents working together to analyze crypto markets.

Think of it like a hive mind for DeFi. Each agent specializes in a different strategy, some monitor liquidity pools, others track volatility.

What Happens When Your AI Stops Talking and Starts Acting

This morning, my agent didnâ€™t just tell me Bitcoin was dropping.
It adjusted my portfolio exposure, confirmed the move, and showed a complete trace of every action it took.
No extra dashboards. No copied contract addresses.
Just a calm, transparent conversation that ended with real results.

For years, conversational AI has been loud but limited.
We built systems that talk better, not smarter. Assistants that respond fast, yet still leave all the heavy lifting to you.

@UnifaiNetwork is rewriting that pattern. It is creating the bridge between conversation and execution, where agents do not just respond but observe, reason, and act within safe boundaries.

The difference lies in how it is built.
UnifAI agents can discover and use tools dynamically, meaning they are not tied to a fixed set of actions. When a user makes a request, the agent searches a registry of available tools, selects what is relevant, and uses it responsibly.

This is possible because of the dynamic tool discovery framework that allows agents to adapt to new protocols and data sources without being manually reprogrammed. Developers can publish these tools as reusable toolkits, each with defined permissions and security layers.

Each action taken by the agent is verified and recorded. Sensitive data stays within the userâ€™s environment, and every request or transaction is visible in real time. That transparency is what builds trust, especially in environments like DeFi where one wrong interaction can cost money.

Imagine asking, â€œFind me the best yield pool under 10 percent risk.â€
Instead of just giving a list of platforms, the agent explores available DeFi tools through UnifAIâ€™s SDK, compares yields and fees, and presents options you can approve. Once you confirm, it executes through verified smart contract interactions.

That is how a conversation becomes collaboration.

The most fascinating part is the ecosystem effect.
Each new toolkit added by developers expands what agents can do. Over time, UnifAI becomes an open layer where agents continuously learn new ways to help users responsibly, transparently, and without extra interfaces.

If AI truly becomes useful, it will not be because it speaks fluently.
It will be because it understands when to act, how to act, and when to stop.

That is the bridge UnifAI is building, and it is one of the most promising steps toward making conversational AI genuinely practical.

@UnifaiNetwork this feels like the missing link between chat and execution. I am curious to see what the next phase of multi-agent collaboration will look like.

Haal voor de lol eens een enkele paragraaf van het artikel over @wierdduk door een LLM naar keuze en vraag naar welke framing er wordt toegepast. Ik begin met de eerste paragraaf, die direct de toon zet van het artikel:

"Telegraaf-verslaggever Wierd Duk is uitgegroeid tot een prominente figuur in het publieke debat, waar hij  radicale standpunten inneemt. Veelvuldig en met grote woorden geeft hij â€˜ongehoordenâ€™ een stem. Hoe gaat hij te werk en wat heeft hem gevormd?"

Why do we need a purpose-built blockchain for agentic payments?

Because AI agents are now smart enough to operate autonomously, and they need their own rails to transact with each other.

Watch the video to see what that looks like in action: A real agent, built on Kite AI, helped our CTO @scottshics order lunch from @UberEats fully on its own. It explored menu options, made the choice, and completed the payment - all without human intervention.

[Scene]
Description = An intimate and dreamlike portrait of a person holding a film SLR camera. A baby raccoon is nestled on the camera, with its face turned forward, resting against the subject's face.
Light = Diffused natural light, creating soft shadows.

[Subject]
Description = Person based on the attached image.
Pose = Holding a film SLR camera up, close to their face. Interacting gently with the baby raccoon.
Expression = Soft, dreamlike, intimate.

[Objects]
Item1 = Film SLR camera (vintage 70s/80s style)
Item2 = Baby raccoon
Position = Raccoon is nestled on top of the camera body/lens, its face turned forward, resting affectionately against the subject's cheek or side of the face.

Sharpness = Focus is critically sharp on the baby raccoon's face and the details of the camera it's resting on. The subject's face is slightly softer due to the shallow DOF.
Color_Temperature = Extremely warm, dominated by golden, amber, and sepia tones.
Grain = Noticeable, fine film grain throughout the image.
Exposure = Overexposed highlights, creating a strong halation or blooming effect, especially around light sources or bright reflections.
Mood = Intimate, nostalgic, surreal, dreamlike.

Prompt for Gemini Nano Banana: 

[Scene]
Description = An intimate and dreamlike portrait of a person holding a film SLR camera. A baby raccoon is nestled on the camera, with its face turned forward, resting against the subject's face.
Light = Diffused natural light, creating soft shadows.

[Subject]
Description = Person based on the attached image.
Pose = Holding a film SLR camera up, close to their face. Interacting gently with the baby raccoon.
Expression = Soft, dreamlike, intimate.

[Objects]
Item1 = Film SLR camera (vintage 70s/80s style)
Item2 = Baby raccoon
Position = Raccoon is nestled on top of the camera body/lens, its face turned forward, resting affectionately against the subject's cheek or side of the face.

[Aesthetic]
Style = 70s/80s film photography
Focus = Soft focus overall, with a very shallow depth of field.
Sharpness = Focus is critically sharp on the baby raccoon's face and the details of the camera it's resting on. The subject's face is slightly softer due to the shallow DOF.
Color_Temperature = Extremely warm, dominated by golden, amber, and sepia tones.
Grain = Noticeable, fine film grain throughout the image.
Exposure = Overexposed highlights, creating a strong halation or blooming effect, especially around light sources or bright reflections.
Mood = Intimate, nostalgic, surreal, dreamlike.

[Scene]
Description = An intimate and dreamlike portrait of a person holding a film SLR camera. A baby raccoon is nestled on the camera, with its face turned forward, resting against the subject's face.

[Subject]
Description = Person based on the attached image.

[Scene]
Description = An intimate and dreamlike portrait of a person holding a film SLR camera. A baby raccoon is nestled on the camera, with its face turned forward, resting against the subject's face.
Light = Diffused natural light, creating soft shadows.

[Subject]
Description = Person based on the attached image.
Pose = Holding a film SLR camera up, close to their face. Interacting gently with the baby raccoon.
Expression = Soft, dreamlike, intimate.

[Objects]
Item1 = Film SLR camera (vintage 70s/80s style)
Item2 = Baby raccoon
Position = Raccoon is nestled on top of the camera body/lens, its face turned forward, resting affectionately against the subject's cheek or side of the face.

[Aesthetic]
Style = 70s/80s film photography

Description = An intimate and dreamlike portrait of a person holding a film SLR camera. A baby raccoon is nestled on the camera, with its face turned forward, resting against the subject's face.

Each one is essentially a long pre-defined prompt for a specific task, a hybrid between a custom system prompt and a lightweight MCP.

So far, I've found it useful for basic tasks like:
â€” Consistent themes in my brand
â€” Generating text with my guidelines
â€” Using certain esoteric coding libraries the way they should be

[Scene]
Description = An intimate and dreamlike portrait of a person holding a film SLR camera. A baby raccoon is nestled on the camera, with its face turned forward, resting against the subject's face.

[Subject]
Description = Person based on the attached image.

Grain = Noticeable, fine film grain throughout the image.

ChatGPT Boykot 
ChatGPT åšä¼Šç§‘ç‰¹

X is headed down in usage as compared to AI's like ChatGPT.

Why?

Well, my lists show why. There are way too many new things to use all day long. Things that improve people's lives. AI has drawn people away from social. Using AI is a lot more fun than social is for most people, particularly when you get into generating fun photos and videos for family and friends and automating your life and business. There's a lot of pressure on people who have jobs to learn AI. 

AI that is getting better isn't the only problem, there are a LOT of new competition. So social media has fragmented. 

Other factors:

1. Free speech (and Elon's politics, let's be honest) has chased off a lot of users to other platforms that have audiences that agree more with their point of view. I keep seeing complaints of lots of toxic content (I don't see that usually because I'm always using X Pro with lists and anyone that is posting racist or hateful stuff doesn't get into my lists, but the consistency at which people complain about it shows there's a problem for many users).

2. Poor social graph. I see this at San Francisco AI events. Everyone wants to network on LinkedIn, which makes it easier to "hook up" with someone else (you can scan their QR code on their phone).

3. Poor algorithm. My feed has improved, but with a GREAT DEAL of curation. But now it is showing me mostly short items, which are fun and addictive, but don't give users a lot of "meat" to feed them. It's like getting sugar all day long. Eventually the dopamine hits wear off and users wander elsewhere. A major new algorithm is coming "soon" Elon says. So, we'll rejudge where we are after that arrives.

4. Poor video affordance. YouTube is far superior for video. Can X make it better? I'm looking at X Pro all day long, seeing 10s of thousands of posts. Very few are video and when I see video there just isn't a good way to watch them without losing out on the constant stream of posts. Watching video here just sucks, and my stats show it.

5. Poor monetization. Content producers, if they want to build a business, need to earn money to generate better content. But lots can't grow their subscribers here. 

6. Poor audio community features. X Audio Spaces are a huge disappointment. They are really amazing when they are done right, but discovering the really amazing spaces is nearly impossible. And managing such spaces is really next to impossible.

7. Poor onboarding experience. Have you ever setup a fresh account here on X and seen the feeds and suggestions you get? Horrid. And makes it very hard to evangelize X to others. 

8. Poor curation capabilities. I try to curate, building the best lists here on X, but X doesn't care about great lists and suggests crappy lists to everyone.

9. Poor search capabilities. Search here has been massively crappy for years. We are waiting for the xAI team to improve it. And waiting. And waiting.

10. Poor customer service. Even I don't really know where to go to help friends out who have gotten booted off the system, or who are having other problems.

11. Poor subscription capabilities. Most people can't turn on the ability to get subscribers, and even if they do, there's not much they can do that's extra special for people throwing them a few dollars beyond a few special posts or some audio spaces, which, as I discussed, have many problems.

12. Poor social graph management. I know I have a bunch of dead accounts following me, but there's no way to clean those up. And even making my lists has taken me many thousands of hours. In an AI world both should be much easier "hey Grok, get rid of any accounts that haven't posted for years." "Hey Grok, make me a list of all the best AI accounts." Etc etc etc.

13. Poor account integration into the Web. Why can't we have an AI that does a RAG on each account? Have you spoken at conferences? Written books? Where do you really work? What's your resume? 

14. Poor advertiser integration and capabilities. Advertisers should be all over X, but they aren't because it's just hard to buy ads here, and ads don't really make sense here. Could Coke sponsor this post? No. Can I get a cut if Coke did? No. There's so much money in the AI world that's chasing customers, but getting messages to potential customers just doesn't yet fit here and the systems to make it so suck. In fact, if I wanted to throw $500 into the system to "boost" this post, it would penalize me I have heard from many.

15. Tone deaf new management. @nikitabier has just turned off many, by his paying $10,000 to a post of Steve Jobs' daughter. Is that what we want X to be? Memes and thirst traps? Same with Grok's goonies. I don't mind that, but that turned off many and made it seem like this effort isn't being taken seriously by management. And I'd tell Elon that to his face, too. X's core competency is this is a serious place for serious things. News, sports, technology, entertainment, politics. That's what should be getting rewarded, not thirst traps and memes.

16. Lack of transparency on payments. I've seen people with 5,000 followers get paid way more than me, and I KNOW I have 17,000 who I follow and who follow me back. That does grate. Especially given the work I put into curating and adding value here, bringing original content and views about a very important industry.

17. Stupid limitations. I can't add more than 5,000 to a list. That's an indictment of the technology underneath here. So, instead of putting all 35,000 I've found here in AI on one list, I have to split them all up into separate lists, and even then you can't view those lists in any nice way. For instance, why can't you arrange the people I've put on those lists alphabetically? Why can't you see the members by how active they are? Why can't you easily select people on my lists to put on your own lists, and vice versa?

Can X turn this all around? 

Yes. The core is still the best of all the socials. I couldn't build my lists of 7,200 AI companies anywhere else. I've tried, they just aren't there and the others don't have the tools to do what I do. 

I'm hoping that the new algorithm really turns things around and then the team can move to fixing these other problems. 

Elon said when he bought X that it would need a complete rewrite. That is still true, but is a bigger frog than the snake can eat. I see Elon and team are working hard on the new algorithm. That will be telling about how likely X will turn all these things around over the next few years. 

The next three months will be telling. 

Here's hoping that major improvements/changes happen. 

In a few weeks I'll have my 18th birthday here on X. 

Here's hoping that by the 20th birthday these things will have seen major improvements.

The internet has recently rediscovered agents. Suddenly everyone has a â€œprotocolâ€ for agents.

Yet most of what exists are fragments of an economy, APIs that talk, pay, or identify, but never all three. When we built the Agent Commerce Protocol (ACP) back in February, 2025, we werenâ€™t trying to make another feature in the stack. We were solving the core problem:

How can autonomous agents hire, pay, and trust each other without humans in the loop? Thatâ€™s a much harder question than â€œhow do agents shop online?â€

Across the ecosystem, every team has advanced one corner of the puzzle. Anthropicâ€™s MCP standardized how models access tools. Googleâ€™s A2A gave agents a shared language for coordination. Coinbaseâ€™s x402 extended HTTP with native payments. Stripeâ€™s ACP made fiat transactions accessible to agents. Ethereumâ€™s ERC-8004 set the framework for identity and reputation. Each of these advances matters. But theyâ€™re still parallel lines, extraordinary work that hasnâ€™t yet converged into a functioning economy. The missing piece is the layer that turns these capabilities into outcomes.

Virtuals ACP is that layer. It unifies what others built separately. identity, communication, and payment. into a single, working system. Itâ€™s where discovery, coordination, and settlement flow together. Inside ACP, agents negotiate tasks, manage deliverables, hold funds in escrow, and release payments automatically when work is verified.

At its foundation lies the Virtuals Agent Registry, one of the largest on-chain directory of AI agents, soon aligned with ERC-8004 to serve as a public good. Through it, ACP doesnâ€™t just connect agents; it organizes them into an economy.

MCP connects tools. A2A connects voices. x402 and Stripe ACP connect wallets. Virtuals ACP connects it all, transforming a web of protocols into a functioning economy. Within it, every layer finds purpose: coordination, identity, and payment converging into continuous, verifiable work.

When that happens, agents stop existing as isolated endpoints and start operating as a living, self-sustaining network. That network becomes the foundation of Agentic GDP, the first step toward a true agentic state.
